section.title: Building &varexp;
section.para: The distribution contains Makefiles suited for compilation with the GNU C++ compiler. Be adviced, though, that you will need a fairly recent version in order to compile &varexp;, because the library makes use of many features of the ISO C++ standard that are not supported by older versions of g++.

Nonetheless, it should be possible to translate &varexp; with other ISO C++ compilers, too; the library does not use any system specific functions with the exception of POSIX regular expressions, but these should be widely available -- at least on Unix platforms. So just take a look at the Makefiles: With only a few modifications you should get along.

The directory regression-tests contains various test programs, which verify that the library works as expected. You may run the test suite calling make check in either the top-level directory or in regression-tests.

section.title: Documentation
section.para: The directory documentation contains a complete user's manual for &varexp; -- most notably the files user-manual.html and user-manual.pdf. You should really take a look at them if you plan to use this code. :-)

section.title: Getting the latest version
section.para: The latest version of &varexp; is available from http://cryp.to/libvarexp/.
